Q1: What is the title of the French drama film directed by Denis Dercourt?

Q2: When did the film compete in a major film festival?
A2: The film competed in the Un Certain Regard section at the 2009 Cannes Film Festival.

Q3: Who played the role of Mathieu in the film?
A3: Vincent Perez played the role of Mathieu.

Q4: Who played the role of Paul in the film?
A4: Jérémie Renier played the role of Paul.

Q5: What is the name of the character played by Anne Marivin?
A5: The character played by Anne Marivin is named Jeanne.

Q6: Who played the role of Major Rogart in the film?
A6: Gérald Laroche played the role of Major Rogart.

Q7: What is the name of the actress who played the role of Christelle?
A7: The actress who played the role of Christelle is Barbara Probst.

Q8: Who played the role of the Duchess in the film?
A8: Béatrice Agenin played the role of the Duchess.

Q9: Can you provide more information about the film's cast?
A9: Sure! The film features a talented cast, including Vincent Perez, Jérémie Renier, Aurélien Recoing, Anne Marivin, Françoise Lebrun, Gérald Laroche, and Barbara Probst.

Q10: How did the film perform at the Cannes Film Festival?
A10: The film competed in the Un Certain Regard section at the 2009 Cannes Film Festival, where it received positive reviews from critics.

Q1: What was HMS Al Rawdah originally named?
A1: The ship was originally named Chenab for the Nourse Line of London.

Q2: Who requisitioned the vessel in 1940?
A2: The British Ministry of Shipping requisitioned the vessel.

Q3: What were the conditions like on board the ship for the internees?
A3: The food was described as "abominable" by survivors, and the internees were packed in "bronchitic squalor" for months or years.

Q4: How many Irish Republican internees died on board the ship?
A4: One Irish Republican internee, Jack Gaffney from Belfast, died on board the Al Rawdah on November 18, 1940.

Q5: What other ships were used as military bases and prisons during this time period?
A5: Other ships that were used as military bases and prisons during this time period include HMS Argenta and HMS Maidstone.

Q6: How long was the Al Rawdah used as a prison ship?
A6: The Al Rawdah was used as a prison ship between 1940 and 1946.

Q7: Who owned the ship before it was requisitioned by the British government?
A7: Before it was requisitioned by the British government, the ship was owned by Khedivial Mail Steamship & Graving Dock.

Q8: How many internees were held on board the Al Rawdah at any given time?
A8: The number of internees held on board the Al Rawdah at any given time is not specified in the passage.

Q9: What was the name of the ship's original owner?
A9: The ship's original owner was the Nourse Line of London.

Q10: In what year was the ship scrapped?
A10: The ship was scrapped in 1953.

Q3: What is the genre of the film according to the passage?
A3: The film is part of Japan's tokusatsu genre, which involves science fiction and/or superhero films that feature heavy use of special effects.

Q4: When was the film released in Japan?
A4: The film was released in Japan on July 19, 1961.

A8: The group of metallic aliens that attack Earth in the film are called "Neptune Men" (also referred to as "the Neptune Men" in the passage).

A9: The scientist who helps develop an electric barrier to block the aliens from coming to Earth is named Shinichi Tachibana.

Q1: What is the name of the submarine in the passage?
A1: Sea Tiger

Q2: Who is the captain of the Sea Tiger?
A2: Lieutenant Freddie Taylor

Q3: What is the top secret mission assigned to the Sea Tiger?
A3: To sink Nazi Germany's new battleship, the Brandenburg, before she transits the Kiel Canal in the Baltic Sea.

Q4: How does the submarine Sea Tiger cross the North Sea?
A4: It picks up three shot-down Luftwaffe pilots from a rescue buoy and prevents their radio alert to German forces.

Q5: What happens when the Sea Tiger enters a minefield?
A5: An airman panics and reveals the Brandenburg's location further ahead than thought.

Q6: How does Lieutenant Taylor decide to pursue the Brandenburg?
A6: He decides on a desperate gamble to pursue the Brandenburg into the German-controlled Baltic Sea.

Q7: What happens when the Sea Tiger fires all its torpedoes at the Brandenburg?
A7: The submarine dives before assessing the impact due to German destroyers dropping depth charges.

Q8: How does Lieutenant Taylor deceive the Germans about the fate of the Sea Tiger?
A8: He expels oil and other debris, including the body of the German airman, to make it appear that the submarine has sunk.

Q9: What happens to the crew of the Sea Tiger after they abandon ship on the Danish island of Hågø?
A9: Hobson, a former merchant seaman who speaks German, persuades Taylor to let him go ashore and search for oil, which they successfully find.

Q10: How does the Sea Tiger refuel after leaving the port?
A10: They use intelligence provided by Hobson about the harbour depth to enter the harbour under cover of darkness and refuel using friendly Danish sailors.

Q11: What happens when the tanker they were able to refuel from is hit by German shells and catches fire?
A11: Taylor continues to leave the port, abandoning the tanker and its crew.

Q12: How does the Sea Tiger return to Britain after sinking the Brandenburg?
A12: The crew is met by an escorting trawler and learns from them that they sank the Brandenburg. The Sea Tiger returns to base, flying the Jolly Roger for the first time.

Q1: What is the name of the film directed by Amy Hobby in her directorial debut?
A1: Coney Island Baby

Q2: Who wrote the screenplay for the film?
A2: Karl Geary

Q3: Where was the film shot?
A3: Sligo, Ireland (also known as "Coney Island")

Q4: What award did Amy Hobby win at the Newport International Film Festival for the film?
A4: Jury Award for "Best First Time Director"

Q5: When was the film's premiere television broadcast?
A5: On the Sundance Channel

Q6: Who is the main character in the film?
A6: Billy Hayes (played by Karl Geary)

Q7: What is Billy's goal in the film?
A7: To get back together with his ex-girlfriend and take her back to America to open a gas station.

Q8: Who are Billy's old friends who are planning a scam in the film?
A8: Franko (played by Andy Nyman) and The Duke (played by Patrick Fitzgerald)

Q9: What is the name of the music composer for the film?
A9: Ryan Shore

Q10: Can you name any of the actors in the film's cast?
A10: Karl Geary, Laura Fraser, Hugh O'Conor, Andy Nyman, Patrick Fitzgerald, Tom Hickey, Conor McDermottroe, David McEvoy, Thor McVeigh, and Sinead Dolan.
